column4: Can anyone help me my computer seems to be stuck at GRUB (typing this on alternate machine).
perhaps.  what does GRUB tell you?
are you at a '>' prompt or a text console with a line selected?
I am at  <username> ~$
doesn't sound like GRUB to me?
rebooted after the install and landed here... I assumed it was/is GRUB
is it normally to be in Bash immediately after installing Ubuntu (hardy alt disc)?
*normal
depends :)
probably not, though.  Did you have to log in?
on whether on is a neewb or not  :)  Yes I did have to log in
okay.  sudo apt-get install tasksel && sudo tasksel install ubuntu-desktop # IIRC
answer:  "couldnt find package taskel"
did you run the first part?  sudo apt-get install tasksel?
yes
did you run 'sudo tasksel install ubuntu-desktop' ?
yes
I did the (hardy text-based) install got message saying remove disc reboot. Did that. Was given option of which OS at startup chose Ubuntu and landed here. Seems odd to me...
did you go through the tasksel prompts?
entering those commands only produces the "command not found" message
uhrm... what happens when you 'sudo apt-get install tasksel'?
sorry was typing 'taskel' instead of 'tasksel" Message reads: " tasksel is already the newest version"
